headline: 2025-10-28 — Researchers who authored the interactive energy state-space model paper issued an intermediate reactive-power control command measured in volt‑ampere reactive (VAR) units to the lower-layer physical model (evidence: “derive intermediate reactive power control, which becomes a control command to the lower layer physical model” and “physical interpretation of instantaneous power and generalized reactive power”).

2025-10-29 — The same research team implemented two controller types — Feedback Linearizing Control (FBLC) and Sliding Mode Control (SMC) — to actuate a controllable voltage source in an RLC test circuit, applying control voltages measured in volts (V) to stabilize the circuit (evidence: “implemented using either Feedback Linearizing Control (FBLC) or Sliding Mode Control (SMC)” and “utilize a simple RLC circuit with a controllable voltage source”).

2025-10-30 — The authors formalized an interaction variable with a physical interpretation as instantaneous power and generalized reactive power, explicitly tying the variable to power units (watts, W, and VAR) for system-wide interaction characterization (evidence: “The same variable captures aggregate system-wide effects … physical interpretation of instantaneous power and generalized reactive power”).
